NAME: Mosquito Artery Forceps, Curved, 5"
Langenbeck Retractor  ( Any Size )
BRIEF: A Langenbeck retractor is a manual, single-ended surgical instrument used to hold back soft tissues and wound edges to provide a clear view of the surgical site. It is made of high-quality stainless steel, which allows for sterilization and long-term use. The retractor typically has a flat, L-shaped or hook-type blade and an ergonomic handle for a secure grip.
DISCRIPTION: Langenbeck retractors come in a variety of sizes and are often sold in sets to provide versatility for different surgical needs.
USAGE:
The versatility and variable blade sizes of the Langenbeck retractor make it a fundamental tool in many surgical disciplines, including: 
General surgery: Used for procedures like biopsies, excisions, and incisions to retract skin, muscle, and subcutaneous tissue.
Orthopedic surgery: Provides clear visibility for orthopedic procedures by retracting tissues.
Oral and maxillofacial surgery: Ideal for holding back the cheeks, lips, and tongue during dental procedures.
Urological procedures: It was originally designed for this specialty by Bernhard von Langenbeck.
Plastic surgery: Used for precise tissue retraction.

NAME: Micro Suction Tip With Thumb Control,No.3
Morris Retractor ( Any Size)
BRIEF: The Morris retractor is a manual, handheld surgical instrument used to retract and hold back soft tissues and organs to improve visibility during surgery. It is available in various sizes to suit different procedures.
DISCRIPTION:
L-shaped or curved blade: This unique blade design allows for deep retraction. The blades have blunted rims to minimize tissue trauma and often a beak-shaped curve at the end to hold tissue securely.
Elongated, slim shaft: This provides a clearer view of the surgical field.
Fenestrated handle: The handle features an ergonomic, ring-shaped, or fenestrated (windowed) design for a secure and comfortable grip, giving the surgeon maximum control.
Stainless steel construction: Made from surgical-grade stainless steel, the retractor is durable, rust-proof, and can be sterilized for repeated use.
Available in multiple sizes: To accommodate a wide range of surgical needs, Morris retractors are manufactured in various blade widths and overall lengths.
USAGE:
Abdominal surgery: Used to hold back the abdominal wall, muscles, and organs during procedures such as appendectomies, hysterectomies, and C-sections.
Thoracoabdominal procedures: Helps widen incision edges to provide access to deep underlying structures in the chest and abdomen.
Orthopedic surgery: Assists in retracting muscles, ligaments, and tendons to provide bone exposure during procedures like joint replacements and spinal surgeries.
Urological surgery: Used to retract tissues for bladder and prostate procedures.
